website_summaries.verdict: This small yet high-quality keyboard comes from a respected manufacturer.
pros: Stands out for its mini keys, which are perfect for small hands
Features 100 keyboard sounds and 50 rhythm patterns
You can make use of the five percussion pads
The 10 rehearsal tunes let you practice songs of different styles
cons: Some buyers report issues with sound quality if you adjust the volume too frequently

customer_reviews.title: Battery compartment started smoking!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 12 year old daughter who's an avid piano player and wanted to play in the car. She doesn't use it very often and today the keyboard started SMOKING!! it was on her lap so she just flung it off and luckily did not get burned. It was apparentlycoming fromthe battery compartment!! We are so disappointed as it seemed to be a fun product. But that it can cause serious injury is awful.
customer_reviews.author: mummy2sweeties

customer_reviews.title: Looks and sounds great
customer_reviews.text: Looks and sounds great...my daughter should be able to learn with this keyboard. I added the stickers to help her learn faster.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broken already with less than 2 months of use...
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is good for beginners, especially children. However, mine has stopped working with less than 2 months of use... It was delivered on October 26th, it stopped working on December 15th... Amazon‘s return policy allows for only 1 month return... Come on, bot even 2 months later the device has already stopped working, and no exchange possible!? I‘m very disappointed...
customer_reviews.author: Tiago S Cerri

customer_reviews.title: It broke right away
customer_reviews.text: I liked it a lot at first but after about a dozen uses 4 of the lower keys stopped working unless you press really hard on them and sometimes they get stuck and stay down. Super disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Mia

customer_reviews.title: NO AC ADAPTER
customer_reviews.text: There was no AC adapter in the package. If you send it, I will edit this review. This makes me so mad. Why not send the plug? This was for my daughter's birthday and now she can't even play it!
customer_reviews.author: Katt

customer_reviews.title: No power supply
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't know how this product performs because it doesn't come with a power supply! Who sells an electrical product that has no power supply? Great way to cheap out on your customers! I hope it was worth saving the 48 cents it costs you to add a cord in. Yes, I am sure if I read fifteen pages of small print it would have mentioned it somewhere... Either way, I will never buy another casio product again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy! I’m very happy!
customer_reviews.text: Great piano, very lightweight but sturdy keys. Sounds great! I bought it for my one and three year old grandsons and they love it! I ordered the monster stickers with the key letters and they fit perfectly! Highly recommend this piano!
customer_reviews.author: Celia Berru

customer_reviews.title: as it sounds only like a small upgrade to the Casio keyboard piano I ...
customer_reviews.text: I'd hoped in 2018 the piano sound would be more realistic, as it sounds only like a small upgrade to the Casio keyboard piano I had in the late 80's. It's obviously not marketed or described as an instrument-quality keyboard, but even for a toy I find the key action to be very cheap and spongy -- my 1980's era Casio had higher-quality action. For the price, it's okay. I got it for my little one so she could learn hand/eye coordination, motor skills and rudimentary ear training. I expect it will take a good amount of drool and abuse, so as long as it lasts through that I'd consider it a decent purchase.
customer_reviews.author: FrankieKat

customer_reviews.title: 4 broken keys
customer_reviews.text: my piano just arrived today, I was really excited until I found out 4 of the keys weren't working... I've tried researching online how to fix this but it seems to be circuits inside that are broken. I am really disappointed it would have been a great product if it weren't for the defects.
customer_reviews.author: Justine

customer_reviews.title: Terrible sound, the keys will "double tap" on a note, very distracting
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to have a keyboard so I could practice while away on vacation. The sound quality was so bad, coupled with the keys being so overly sensitive that a note would be sounded twice (no matter how careful I was with my fingering). This might be an ok instrument for a baby to bang on and goof around with, but not anyone who is serious about playing. Don't waste your money!!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Byrd

customer_reviews.title: My kids are disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I am very unhappy with this item. After 6 months of a little use it consistently stops working after hitting a few keys and has to be turned off and on to reset. My kids are disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Adams

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product....came just as described. I only wished an adapter came with it. It w would save me b u ting batteries. The manual says that one can work with the keyboard however you w o old have to buy that separate.
customer_reviews.author: CS XOXO

customer_reviews.title: Awesome keyboard!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to practice piano on my couch while I recovered from an injury. This keyboard has a built in adjustable metronome and accompaniment background sounds. I purchased separately the plug in adapter to save burning through batteries. This keyboard is great for my small hands and even encouraged my son to practice more. It is also the perfect size for travel . I recently took it on a road trip and was able to play as my husband drove. Then I even played for my cousin's preschool class. I highly recommend this portable keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a 5-year-old girl who likes pink & music!
customer_reviews.text: My 5-year-old daughter wanted a "pink piano". I searched everywhere: most pink pianos are for 2-4-year olds (officially also for older kids, but reading the review, most are truly for young kids). Then I found this Casio. My daughter LOVES it! The bottom & sides are pink. The sound is great. She loves the 10 songs (and increasing / decreasing the tempo!) and the 100 different sounds. This was a PERFECT present for her! I'm still trying to figure out if I should buy a stand + bench for her -- she's right now using it while sitting on the floor, on her bed, or in the car...
customer_reviews.author: C. B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Would have promptly rated this item five stars, but I was greatly disappointed that I had to purchase the plug-in outlet separately. I suppose I should have read more carefully. However, imagine my surprise when wrapping this up as a gift for my granddaughter when I discovered NO electric source. I quickly purchased it separately - keep this in mind when happily paying the original price. Regardless, the keyboard is perfect for my 7 year old granddaughter. It's lightweight and has good tone. I purchased the Asurion Warranty separately and will not be worrying about her dropping or breaking the keyboard. The instrument makes a great gift for young fingers thanks to the 44 keys. I recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Winnie

customer_reviews.title: Why didn't you mentioned that a power cord or batteries were needed?????
customer_reviews.text: Nowhere on the product description does it suggest to by a power cord or that batteries were needed. So I have this gorgeous keyboard that does NOTHING. Very disappointed. The power cord should be FREE! We are in the middle of a pandemic. It's not like I can run out and get something today. Frustrating . Aaargh!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small and convenient
customer_reviews.text: I home school my 6 yr old grandson and he wanted to learn the piano....this is very reasonably priced for a beginner and I bought the note tabs and a beginners book of music and he learned how to play twinkle twinkle little star in the first 20 minutes...it was awesome....so easy to use and carry from room to room...just sit it on a table ...he also likes the other buttons that add the sound of different instruments...and the buttons that play other songs...I loved it and so does he!!
customer_reviews.author: P Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Kids only...
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 5 year old to lear basics of keyboard. This is good for kids for initial learning. Pros: - Decent price - light weight, can carry around easily - Sufficient sounds for initial learning - good for people who wants to replace harmonium. Cons: - Average built. Except bit better from brand like Casio - Key plastic feels really cheap Overall, if you are buying for kid who just started learning, this will help in initial phase to know if your kid really has interest in piano/keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: Not pressure sensitive
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - The size is really convenient for learning. I have mine right next to my computer that I use for looking at music and watching lectures on music theory. - It can be battery powered or plugged in, and it's very portable. Cons: - The keys are not pressure sensitive (they play at the same volume regardless of how hard you press). - The volume slider is of low quality sometimes you have to hold down on it to get the piano to play at the right volume, otherwise it plays at full volume.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what I wanted it for
customer_reviews.text: This little keyboard is perfect for what I needed it for. I bought this for my dad. He has always loved playing the piano and keyboard. He recently had a stroke, so I bought this little keyboard as a way to help get him to start working his effected hand and arm again, while at the same time it would be something he enjoys doing. He loves the little keyboard and it helps him also.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Seawright

customer_reviews.title: Perfect starter keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for the exact same keyboard which I had left batteries in for far too long and they leaked all over. I had gotten this for my son at about two and a half just to play with and he loved it then. Just as something to go though all kinds of sounds and play with it’s tons of fun. Getting older and actually playing things it’s just a great simple starter that has about all the sounds you could need. Maybe look at getting the power adapter that’s sold separately so you don’t leak battery acid everywhere. Not a problem with the keyboard, just something that will happen with old batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Lane

customer_reviews.title: this is a great buy. Has most of the sound features of ...
customer_reviews.text: For the money, this is a great buy. Has most of the sound features of regular electronic keyboards (drums, beats, different tones) but is extremely portable. Takes 6 AA batteries, or plugs into your wall (charger sold seperately unfortunately). I take it down to the beach, or camping, or to the park for little jam sessions with my musician friends. Keys are smaller than you're used to, but they're not annoying. I recommend for beginners, children, or even serious piano players who just want something to carry along everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: My grandson's first keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: This was my 5 year old grandson's Christmas gift. (His first keyboard!) Perfect price, seems durable. Battery life still good after 2 weeks. (I found a power supply for it also) He's learning all the functions a little at a time. I recommend!
customer_reviews.author: videodon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little keyboard for CHEAP PRICE
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect little keyboard for little kids. Not too expensive that you can easily replace it if your kids break it like my kids did. Even though this keyboard maybe look cheap but the sound it puts out is AWESOME!. It is LOUD and CLEAR and has a lots of options when it comes to beats, rhythms, songs, tones, etc. It even has little display that shows you what notes you playing. Oh by the way, did I mention that this is our 3rd keyboard I bought for my kids. :) My kids (5 and 7) love it so much that they sometimes fight over this keyboard. :) So, I recommend this keyboard to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: T. N.

customer_reviews.title: Low quality
customer_reviews.text: A couple loose piece inside moving around, 1 key stopped working, the screen is dim not. 2 months of use is all. Cant return it either. Not worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Carfix101

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work on adapter power.
customer_reviews.text: I received a defective one..casio doesnt work on adapter power you need hold the pin and press down but gets disconnected while playing..beware of such incidents as it totally ruins your excitement ..
customer_reviews.author: Pradhan Salian

customer_reviews.title: Small and sweet
customer_reviews.text: Got this for when I’m on the road and want to work out chords but don’t want a full sized keyboard. Perfect for what I need and would be lots of fun for a kid of pretty much any age. I think it turns off after a while if you forget to turn off power. My one negative is there is not a power light and the screen is not lighted so I often forget to turn it off, and in super bright conditions it may be hard to read the screen. Also the built in tunes are hilarious as always :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced for what it is
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this keyboard for its portability and features, but it feels very cheap, almost made-in-china-discount-catalog toy cheap. Even if it worked properly, it's worth no more than $30. Aside from being overpriced, one of the keys goes all tremolo on its own :-(
customer_reviews.author: St Golden

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to begin music lessons with this keyboard. Then it came to my house and I opened it and inserted the batteries as per the instructions and the sound kept going out. The keys were way too small as well. This is why I dislike this keyboard so much and I do not recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Mahajan

customer_reviews.title: Average a bit tinny
customer_reviews.text: A bit tinny but overall its ok for a mid beginner—- keys are small yes but an adult can use this- i bought for quarantine so i can play while in bed which is my new office during coronavirus- it works well for this purpose. Its a good quality kids toy keyboard basically.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Marie

customer_reviews.title: Great affordable keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 6-year-old. She likes it and we have fun messing around with it. It's not quite full size - my daughter says it's a few keys shorter than what she uses at school - but it works for her practice playing. An adult can easily carry this around, to hide it away or whatever. It also seems like it would be great for those that have music skill but don't have space or budget for a full size keyboard. I have zero piano skills and still enjoy plucking away at this thing occasionally - if I could play it would be really fun.
customer_reviews.author: Hoosier B

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the SA76 at a reduced price, even cheaper than the 12-keys-less SA46, by getting one "Like New". The keyboard seemed brand new; only the box had flaws. Manual was included, as well as original packaging material. The keyboard worked great with an adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Shaffer

customer_reviews.title: You can buy a better keyboard for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This.. is more of a novelty than it is a really portal into the world of keyboard. There are keyboards of actual quality, then there are keyboards that have really campy sounds and are really cheesy but they are still great because of how cheesy they are. This is neither. This is just a bad keyboard. The action response sucks. The sounds are devoid of life. For the price you could really get a far better vintage Casio from the 90s on ebay that sounds and feels way better. Only really gets stars for having good speakers and for looking cool.
customer_reviews.author: A. Foruzani

customer_reviews.title: pretty cool for the price
customer_reviews.text: if you want a keybaord to mess around with or take around this is pretty cool. definitely not as good as a more expensive model but you cant expect that in something at this price point and this does the job pretty decent. I bought 2 so i could jam out with my girlfriend. also i was watching a recent adam sandler stand up on netflix and i noticed a scene where he is playing music in the subway and his friend is playing this exact keyboard while he sings.
customer_reviews.author: peter jaquay

customer_reviews.title: Sounds and looks great! Keys are on the small side for an adult but it’s still worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I played piano for years growing up but had fallen out of practice. I wanted a small keyboard to get back into it and toy around with. I love the look of it. I ordered the one with the hot pink base. So far, so good. It sounds great! The keys are small and more suitable for kids, but you can’t beat the price. Casio is a good and trusted brand. I also ordered the adapter so I wouldn’t have to worry about batteries. It’s been great but I’ll update this post should it crap out on me.
customer_reviews.author: teri

customer_reviews.title: Really nice keyboard
customer_reviews.text: My 12 year old grandson loves this keyboard! I bought him one a bit cheaper two years ago and it went everywhere with him along with headphones. He has ADHD and this served to quieten him down during very restless periods. He is a straight "A" student and was even allowed to take it to school and play it in the Principals office when he got really bored. He wore out two keys on his old one so I hope this one lasts a bit longer. He moves to more advanced classes next semester plus is taking "Coding" on the side so, along with this keyboard, should be a happy young man.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Potable and handy instrument
customer_reviews.text: My kid just started learning music and we wanted to buy a keyboard that had all teh basic keys for him to learn, This has all the necessary keys and is portable so that he can carry it to the class. I also bought the AC adapter as did not want to buy 6 odd batteries. Year later - one fine day it stopped working. I will question the reality as kids were only using this during their music class, this was not miss handled. Due to this I will give 3 start.
customer_reviews.author: GP

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and ok sound
customer_reviews.text: I am a seasoned pianist and bought this for travel only toentertain myself when away from my full size $3000 electronic piano. The sound is okay, and I am able to adjust to the mini keys fairly easily. IMHO it would make a good starter keyboard for any child with some interest in the piano because of it's affordability. I suspect this little device will fit the bill for my intended purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Nerdgirl

customer_reviews.title: Feels like a toy but extremely portable
customer_reviews.text: This feels like a toy (feels plasticky) compared to my CTK-3500 which has bigger and touch sensitive keys (feels like weighted keys.) But that keyboard costs almost thrice as much and is a lot heavier. So I give this three stars for its portability and due to the fact that I can take this with me wherever I go (just like a Junior size acoustic guitar.) This keyboard weighs like virtually nothing and it also has decent sound and volume. Don’t recommend this for a beginner to learn on though.
customer_reviews.author: JosephLag

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Original product received didn’t work right, there was a short in the volume button. Replacement item is fine. I got this mainly to pound out parts for choir that I’m in, I like that it’s fairly compact. It has lots of features that I’ll probably never use. Seems like a decent value.
customer_reviews.author: Emptysack

customer_reviews.title: Casio seriously is the name to go with
customer_reviews.text: So first of all it's Casio you can't go wrong, second everybody knows how to use the web and I tell you this particular offering is spot-on and is working out just great for my four year old. I own a much larger more sophisticated Casio but I'm not ready to let my daughter loose on it until she's a little bigger and expresses an interest. Get it with the power supply but with the batteries the thing does last
customer_reviews.author: mike000mike

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Would give it a better review, but it wouldn't even turn on. Bummer!
customer_reviews.author: Nadia Stetson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little high quality keyboard that will keep your kids entertained for hours and may even peak their interest in delving further into music. My 4 year old loves playing the built in songs and testing his musical skills but my 7 year old nephew does just about everything possible on this and it keeps him occupied for quite a while. This is probably the best intro keyboard out there for younger kids.
customer_reviews.author: Jerome

customer_reviews.title: We like it
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is well made, sounds great and takes a beating. My son has special needs and loves music. Unfortunately he is very rough with keyboards. This one holds up to everything he can dish out. It plays great and is just the right size. It’s his favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Good buy.
customer_reviews.text: It's your average keyboard. I bought it a year ago for my 5 yo granddaughter and it's more than adequate. It's not a full keyboard so it's not for anyone serious, but she loves it and it's held up well. I recommend buying the power supply too (sold separately).
customer_reviews.author: Jojo57

customer_reviews.title: No wall adapter!
customer_reviews.text: Pay attention. This does not come with a plug-in. Disappointing to give to your child as a present only to realize if you don't have batteries they can't play with it! After buying a plug-in, great item. Maybe it was listed as such but I certainly missed it.
customer_reviews.author: Idaho

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard for our 9 year old
customer_reviews.text: looks, sounds, works great. My only problem with it (and the reason it loses a star) is that the battery cover falls right off. It was like that right out of the box and is nothing we or my son did. We have to use tape to keep it on. Just a dumb problem to have on a brand new product. Otherwise, it's a great little keyboard and we're happy.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas S.

customer_reviews.title: Broken keys not recommended
customer_reviews.text: At first i loved this keyboard. It was the right size for my 5 year old daughter and sounded nice for what it is. After 2 weeks the black keys started to break off. She is supervised with it so i know it’s not from her being rough on it. I do not recommend this keyboard
customer_reviews.author: Daniel T.

customer_reviews.title: Play at your couch while watching TV
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. I feel guilty whenever I just sit and watch TV. I need to play an instrument every day or I feel like I’m losing. After buying this keyboard, I can sit on the couch and play it on my lap. I’m not a loser anymore!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. My daughter loves it and she is learning new songs. Compact size is perfect. Only think I didn't like is that I had to get a separated power adapter to use it
customer_reviews.author: Anali Marisol Contreras Pugliese

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: Lots of product for a good price! My daughter loves this keyboard! The instruction booklet is clear and easy to understand, the sound is very good quality, and the features are many. She can create many different background sounds to accompany her as she learns to play songs, either in piano or organ mode. I am very please with this item but more importantly, my 11-year-old daughter can operate this independently and is getting many hours of enjoyment out of her Casio keyboard. The many different features has kept her interested in creating music and I appreciate that. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Penny C

customer_reviews.title: but still good quality. A perfect starter keyboard for a young ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a future gift for a grandchild. It arrived in a timely fashion, well packaged. I tried it out and found it to be as I expected. All keyboards are lightweight, but still good quality. A perfect starter keyboard for a young child, I think.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Gaskill

customer_reviews.title: Battery exploded in the back
customer_reviews.text: I had a blast playing this keyboard during this past week since I've bought it. However today as I was playing, a loud pop came from the back of the keyboard. I turned it around, opened the battery compartment, and one of the batteries was leaking and it seems as though the top of the - side had popped. I used 6 AA Duracell batteries, all brand new. Looking into the problem online, it seems as though the problem lies within the keyboard, and not the batteries. Hopefully I just got a defective one and this isn't the case with all the keyboards.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well - good
customer_reviews.text: I like this for my needs. I use it to connect to Garage Band on my Mac. I am by no means a professional but like to work out tunes and play with the different sounds. Good value for the money

customer_reviews.title: A good keyboard for a beginner.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard for my 96 year old mother with dementia who loves music. Granted, she hasn't learned to play it, but she has a lot of fun with it. It has a number of rhythmic beats, buttons for various drum sounds, and presets for a number of instruments. It can be powered with batteries or an optional electrical cord. I bought the electrical cord, but we use rechargeable batteries that last a long time to make it more portable. My Mom has enjoyed this keyboard. So, for me, it was a worthwhile purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Judy L.Top Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: We acquired this as a travel practice board for a kid. It works and fits in the checked luggage. The alternate keyboard sounds are low quality electronica. The other functions we tried work. It is one step above a kiddie board. My home unit is a 76 key Casio that has lasted 20 years(too big to fly).
customer_reviews.author: Thadeus McTaggert

customer_reviews.title: A great sounding keyboard...choose this one!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my young granddaughter who absolutely loves it! She wants to play for the family all the time! She is teaching herself to play songs and is doing a fantastic job! Great, great sound and lots of added instrumental sounds to compliment the keyboard melodious notes!
customer_reviews.author: Vee

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard ... beware no ac adapter..
customer_reviews.text: So... I’ll be quick.. keyboard is great! But... no ac adapter... so I gotta give you all 3 stars.. the product itself is great.. but my daughter can’t play it...
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: Casio cool
customer_reviews.text: For $50 plus shipping this has got to be the slickest keyboard. I have a number of keyboards and this is a nice addition. It has some really good sounds tones. And the patterns are pretty neat too. The cons are on some of the patterns there are instrumentation and you can't change the pitch like a regular accompaniment. That's about the only flaw.
customer_reviews.author: William e Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as Christmas present for my 6 year old as an entry way instrument into music. Overall has been a good keyboard, plays nice, she loves the pre recorded songs and the ability to change the tones. It's light weight, plenty loud enough and batteries have lasted a long time with moderate use.
customer_reviews.author: JNV

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard for kids and music lovers
customer_reviews.text: I like how this keyboard isn't that heavy. I bought it for my daughter whether she's ready for it or not I think having a instrument in the house makes sense especially because music is one of the most amazing things in life. They should of mention that you need to also buy the adapter that doesn't come with it unless you prefer to buy batteries is up to you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would give less than one star. Broke right away
customer_reviews.text: Broke right away after hardly any use by a 10 year old girl. She really was playing very normal and not banging it around or anything.
customer_reviews.author: Esty B.

customer_reviews.title: A very reasonably priced starter keyboard, but don't forget the AC Adaptor!
customer_reviews.text: An amazing value, considering all the technology packed into this little device. We gave it as a gift to a friend's five year old child, recently, so our long-term use evaluation cannot be completed as of this time. One does need to buy the AC adaptor separately, in order to be freed of costly battery supply. But, even with the adaptor, the price is extremely reasonable. The small size of the keys are a good start for little fingers. If the child remains interested in music for a few years, then one can advance to a full size keyboard. Mercifully for others, there is a headphone jack, allowing practice without creating a disturbance in the home!
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Gene Belcher? Is that you?
customer_reviews.text: My son really wanted a Bob’s Burgers style keyboard for his 8th birthday. Gene’s blue Casio keyboard would sell well if it existed!! But orange is a favorite color and our son likes showing people how you can have it play songs for you so we are happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kari Harlan

customer_reviews.title: For young child
customer_reviews.text: Too small for my adult fingers (but maybe not yours), this is a very sturdy intro, toy keyboard for children. One star off for inclusion of some uninteresting and useless rhythm patterns and tones. But, really, a miracle packaged in this little thing. Our toddler is fascinated with it but it can be a struggle to keep him from "starting" a pre-recorded sample song, something he figured out too quickly. Will have no reluctance to upgrade to a full sized keys instrument in a year or two.
customer_reviews.author: Elena Chen

customer_reviews.title: Fun and convenient to use
customer_reviews.text: Bought a used/re-boxed keyboard for our two year old son's birthday. He is having a lot of fun with it. I have several synthesizers and a piano in the house, but I find myself playing around on it pretty often. Very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: David F Knowlden

customer_reviews.title: She loves that it changes the notes to sound like different instruments and also has prerecorded songs she can ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves. She is taking a pre-piano class that uses a keyboard. Works very well and no issues. She loves that it changes the notes to sound like different instruments and also has prerecorded songs she can play with. I did purchase the accompanying wall plug in to save on battery usage.
customer_reviews.author: cm

customer_reviews.title: Adequate key size for adult female,simultaneous note play
customer_reviews.text: Adequate key size for adult,adequate #of keys to play with 2 hands. YOU CAN PLAY SEVERAL NOTES AT ONCE,on some,you can only sound one,so,no chords or harmony.It has earphone jack,plug Jack,6 v.but no cord comes with,hence,4 stars
customer_reviews.author: Pom Lover

customer_reviews.title: Great portability, decent sound
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to take with me to practice on vacation, or even take on the couch with some earbuds since you can't carry a piano or large keyboard around. I credit this keyboard for helping me pass my first college piano course.
customer_reviews.author: Maria B.

customer_reviews.title: Portable, with great sound.
customer_reviews.text: I like using a mini keyboard on the go, to work on my voice part for my Sweet Adeline chorus. My 32-key Casio, adequate for higher voice, only reaches the F below middle C. The extra 12 keys, all below middle C, lets me practice, or assist any part, from tenor to bass. Exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: girlsinger

customer_reviews.title: Only worked a few years then broke
customer_reviews.text: Used this with a battery for a few years since an adapter is not included. You have to buy that separately. It worked for three years and then broke. Seems like it should have lasted longer. We hardly used it.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Watson

customer_reviews.title: It's s nice work station
customer_reviews.text: my 88 key Broke and i got this i love casio this was affordable right now it's great i love it i put it on the arm of my big chair and make music to my songs i wrote Awesome takes a bit to get to if you are use to a big 88 key but hey i love it
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia L. Benson

customer_reviews.title: This keyboard has been great to support the home practice of my kindergarten piano ...
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard has been great to support the home practice of my kindergarten piano student. I hesitated to go with a larger, more expensive model to avoid overspending in case she didn't stick with lessons. This has served her well in her Harmony Road curriculum to this point.
customer_reviews.author: Sean and Mandy Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Portable and sounds great
customer_reviews.text: Cute and nice little keyboard. My 7 year old loves it. Portable, battery operated, and batteries last for some time. Not probably very durable considering it is portable, could use some bumpers or stronger case. Would like to have a built-in handle or case to be able to easily carry this.
customer_reviews.author: Photochic

customer_reviews.title: Wow. I now need to pay $20 for a power outlet or feed it batteries???
customer_reviews.text: The listing said it didn't come with a speaker adapter, but said nothing about the fact that there is now power source for this electric keyboard. After I go to the store, or buy a power cord, I'm sure it'll be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with our purchase
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with our purchase. Works well, has great tone. Only downfall was that an wall adapter was not included. We haven't used it long enough to speak on battery life, but we will be ordering the wall charger to avoid having to replace batteries.
customer_reviews.author: F. Schur

customer_reviews.title: Good key-board for beginners
customer_reviews.text: We are happy with the sound quality and the collection of in-built tunes. The only reason I am giving a 4-star rating is that it doesn't come with a power supply / charger. We either have to buy it separately, or keep using AA batteries.
customer_reviews.author: QWERTY

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: Love this keyboard! It’s perfect for my daughter (1 yr) to play with on the floor and my husband loves to play around with it with her. Works perfectly! The only things I don’t love are that the cover for the batteries on the bottom comes off very easily and it turns itself off after a rather short time, which means I have to keep jumping up to turn it back on for my daughter. But for the price I love it and would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice beginner keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been wanting to learn how to play the keyboard/piano for a while now. I didn’t want to spend a lot of money though so figured this would be a good beginner piano. So far it’s good, the screen in the middle of the piano shows which notes you’re playing which is really helpful.
customer_reviews.author: dayna marie seevers

customer_reviews.title: Lots of notes in a small package!
customer_reviews.text: I love this! I use it to accompany my piano students. I can sit next to them and we don’t have to share a keyboard. It’s small keys like a toy, but that gives you the maximum amount of notes to use for something I just prop up on my knee.
customer_reviews.author: Joellyn Jarvis

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight but kid friendly
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old wanted a piano for Christmas. After LOTS of research we chose this one. We loved the bright orange bottom, the fact that it can plug in OR use batteries, and that it has a headphone jack. It’s been one of his favorite gifts and provided so much independent entertainment for him.
customer_reviews.author: MRS. B

customer_reviews.title: * * * * *  5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: This works just fine for my needs. I'm a singer and use it for rehearsing my parts. I don't know that it would be good for a serious keyboard player. But it's perfect for my needs and my range.
customer_reviews.author: Kate in Sacramento

customer_reviews.title: Check the box to make sure everything is in there. I was missing my power adapter.
customer_reviews.text: Well I would have given this 5 stars but I didnt recieve my adapter power cord. So i have to rely on batteries to power the keyboard. It was a Christmas gift for my daughter. If I could please get my power cord please that would be nice.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is pretty nice and works great. I'm very new to using a keyboard and playing one for that matter, the only thing that was missing for me was some sort of manual for how to use the different options on it. Still learning how to use it but it's works great for anyone that likes to start learning how to play.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice for my little one
customer_reviews.text: Excellent choice for my little one. My father plays the keyboard very well and learning from him my 2 yr old is starting to show interest. Time will tell but this is an excellent product and with the option to have batteries the portability is excellent. Also the batteries last a long time even when you play it to the maximum volume. Build quality is also very good.
customer_reviews.author: Aniket

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a young learner
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard delivered today. Seems to be a great product and one the our young grandson who has autistic tendencies will totally love. We are very sure he will love trying to create the music he loves. He so loves listening to music and trying to create it using pots, pan and other items in the house. we are sure he will love having an actual keyboard he can create his own music on.
customer_reviews.author: Judy or Bobby Dee

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great toy for the price!! so durable! I bought it when my son was only 1 year old, I didn't want a little piano that didn't last long. My son is 3 years old now and stills plays with it. Lovely tunes to keep them entertained. It has fallen several times and still intact. Highly recommend it!!
customer_reviews.author: Faithliz

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: My daughter waited with excitement for this keyboard, we pulled it out of the box and put in batteries. She played a couple notes, then nothing! No sound of any sort would come out of this keyboard. Returned!
customer_reviews.author: masonhens

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard for a beginner to the music world. My 3 year old granddaughter may still be a bit too young to understand all the controls and buttons, but it's simple enough for her to just play on the keyboard, and in time, she will continue to learn what different buttons do. Can't go wrong with a Casio keyboard, IMO.
customer_reviews.author: AJA

customer_reviews.title: Was a great size for getting out to play and able to put away when needed.
customer_reviews.text: Grandson said he likes to play it but needs a chart to know the notes. Didn’t mention sound quality or volume control. He also plays the violin at school. Since he lives far away, I haven’t been able to hear him. Any suggestions for a beginners chart for him? He is 12.
customer_reviews.author: Kim B.

customer_reviews.title: Keys strike nice. Nice sound.
customer_reviews.text: Nice and simple. Enough keys for a new person. Sounds pretty good actually. Like the idea of battery and power adapter. Adapter one needs to buy seperate but they are reasonable if needed
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: as expected
customer_reviews.text: for such price you ate not expecting a good quality sound keyboard. I bought this for my son to practice when he is on a trip or need to bring to school. the size is the advantage for carrying but hard for playing since the key areas ate much smaller than regular. well it's as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Alfred

customer_reviews.title: Make no mistake: it’s a child’s toy
customer_reviews.text: It sounds, plays, and has features like a child’s toy. So it’s good for that purpose. But I thought it would be a viable portable laptop practice keyboard for my 12-year-old and it was not suitable for that.
customer_reviews.author: Tooky

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL CASIO SA-77!
customer_reviews.text: I love it! I gave away my Casio SA-76, and immediately bought this SA-77. The sound is really amazing. The size and gray color are just right for my tiny apartment, and the volume control allows me to play late at night.
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: Very acceptable learning keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Works as intended and tones are perfectly acceptable for those not too keen on perfect sound. So in essence, it’s a fantastic learning device. A few donwnsides being the tones being much too electronic and not realistic enough for those with much more keen ears. Also, it does not include batteries OR the charging cable for the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Mario

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!!
customer_reviews.text: Family of six: 16 yo, 4 yo, and twin 2 up’s. We all are loving learning to play on this keyboard. Easy to use, lots of preprogrammed music, and we added sticker notes on the keys.
customer_reviews.author: Elo

customer_reviews.title: awesome piano for beginners
customer_reviews.text: awesome piano for beginners, easy to carry ... worth buying
customer_reviews.author: yep

customer_reviews.title: Nicely priced Keyboard for a starter
customer_reviews.text: It has lots of bells and whistles for a cheaper Keyboard- the thing that made me scratch my head was why on earth they do not include a power supply !! so xmas morning we need 6 Double A batteries !! thats the only thing I have negative to say-the keyboard itself has lots of extras and great fun. - now excuse me while I try to find somewhere open xmas morning that sells batteries !!
customer_reviews.author: D. Call

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love, love, love this little keyboard. Can't play worth a darn but I'm having fun learning! It has so many other sounds like drums, music built in, etc. It takes up so little space in my tiny living room I just leave it set up. Sorry I didn't buy it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Exercise your fingers and your brain.  Annoy your parents or maybe a Mother in Law.  Casio Key Board .. great fun
customer_reviews.text: Gift for my Sister ... She loves it. There is a lot packed into this key board. You want options, you got em. Price is right as well. I have not used it. I trust my Sister's opinion. Hours of fun and maybe get you Carnegie Hall. Selling Vendor is GOOD PEOPLE ... shop here and pat yourself on the back for being so smart and frugle.
customer_reviews.author: the reviewer

product_meta.title: Casio SA-76 44-Key Mini Personal Keyboard
product_meta.description: Color:Orange| Style:SA-76, OrangeThe 44 key Casio SA-76 offers children the essentials for playing those first tunes. 100 tones, 50 rhythms and 10 integrated songs provide variety. The LSI sound source and the 8-note polyphony ensure good sound quality. The LC display helps with selecting different music options. The SA-76 also includes a striking change-over switch making it easy to switch between piano and organ modes. 100 Tones: An extensive repertoire of 100 tones is available in excellent quality. 50 Rhythms: 50 rhythms ranging from waltz through to salsa offer a varied range spanning throughout the world of music. Piano/Organ Setting Button: Your favourite tune at the touch of a button: The piano/organ setting button enables you to choose between the sound of a piano and an organ. Simply press the button to switch between the two sounds. 10 Practice Tunes: Something to suit every taste: 10 practice tunes offer the opportunity of learning a diverse range of styles. LC Display: Retain an overview: The LC display provides you with easy access to the instrument’s functions. Five Drum Pads: Find the right rhythm for the beat: The drum pads provide the perfect introduction to the world of the digital drum kit. Five buttons, each with an individual drum or percussion sound making it easy to play along to the rhythm or create a solo with your fingertips. Melody Cut Rehearsal System: Melody Cut provides effective training for the right hand. There are 10 rehearsal songs waiting to be practised.Speakers:2 x 1.2 W
feature_bullets: 44 mini-sized keys and 5 percussion pads , Amp Output - 0.8＋0.8 Watts
100 sounds and 50 rhythm patterns. Dimension: 23.8 inch W x 8.3 inch D x 2.24 inch H
Simple tone selection with PIANO, ORGAN tone button and melody on/off lesson function
Product doesn't include an adapter.Speakers:2 x 1.2 W
NOTE: Refer user manual before use

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars2,596 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
